snippet: Though candidates usually take more moderate positions in the general election, Mr. Trump continues to alienate certain groups, leaving him stagnant in the polls....
abstract: Donald J Trump has been unable to crack 45 percent of vote against Hillary Rodham Clinton in several swing states, sign suggesting that he has hit ceiling of voter support; Trump’s advisers express confidence in their strategy and question whether public polls are fully accurate.

byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti contributed reporting from Erie, Pa. Giovanni Russonello contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Though candidates usually take more moderate positions in the general election, Mr. Trump continues to alienate certain groups, leaving him stagnant in the polls.

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Missteps Risk Putting a Ceiling Over His Support in Swing States
headline.print_headline: Trump’s Remarks Cut Into Support in Swing States
